title: Atomic Layer Etching Process
description: Schema for defining parameters and stages in an Atomic Layer Etching (ALE) process, specifically tailored for precise control of layer-by-layer etching of materials like Al2O3, GaN, AlGaN, AlNx, HfO2, VO2, ZnS, W, and WO3 using various plasma and thermal chemistries.

processType.description: Type of ALE process, either plasma-based or thermal.

reactants.description: List of chemicals used in the ALE process, including fluorination agents and metal precursors.

material.description: Material being etched, e.g., Al2O3, GaN, AlGaN, AlNx, HfO2, VO2, ZnS, W, WO3.

directionality.description: Specifies if the etching is directional (anisotropic) or omnidirectional (isotropic).

temperature.description: Operational temperature in Celsius for the ALE process.

plasmaPower.description: Power of the plasma used in the ALE process, measured in watts.

rfPower.description: Radio frequency power used in the ALE process, measured in watts.

pressure.description: Chamber pressure during the ALE process, measured in Torr.

substrate.description: Substrate used during the ALE process

reactor.description: Reactor used for the ALE process

pulseTimes.description: Pulsing times for the reactants during the ALE process, measured in seconds.

purgeTimes.description: Purging times for the reactants during the ALE process, measured in seconds.

gasFlowRates.description: Gas flow rates for reactants during the ALE process, measured in standard cubic centimeters per minute (sccm).

SF4.description: Sulfur tetrafluoride gas flow rate, used as a fluorination agent.

HF.description: Hydrogen fluoride gas flow rate, used in conversion fluorination processes.

DCSelfBias.description: Direct current self-bias during the ALE process, measured in volts.

ALEWindow.description: Operational window for the ALE process defining the limits of process parameters for effective etching.

temperatureRange.description: Range of operational temperatures for effective etching.

etchPerCycle.description: Etch per cycle (EPC), measured as the thickness of material removed per cycle in nanometers.

etchedMaterialProperties.description: Properties of the material after etching.

surfaceRoughness.description: Surface roughness of the etched material, measured in nanometers.

uniformity.description: Uniformity of the etching process across a wafer.

variance.description: Variance in etch depth across the wafer.

filmComposition.description: Composition of the film after etching.

synergy.description: Synergy factor indicating the effectiveness of alternating sub-cycles.

selectivity.description: Selectivity of the etching process towards different materials.

selectiveTo.description: Materials to which the process is selective.

otherAspects.description: Other considerations such as safety, environmental impact, and process scalability.

safety.description: Safety considerations for the ALE process.

environmentalImpact.description: Environmental impact considerations for the ALE process.
